content: Isaiah Called to Be a Prophet(A)
In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and the train of His  filled the temple.
Above it stood seraphim; each one had six wings: with two he covered his face, with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.
And one cried to another and said:
And the posts of the door were shaken by the voice of him who cried out, and the house was filled with smoke.
Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a live coal  he had taken with the tongs from the altar.
And he touched my mouth  and said:
